result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew W Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  *Clerk of Courts office to pay out restitution paid to the victim.  Bond on file to be applied and any balance is to be returned to the poster.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew W Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Faxed Request for documents from Dept of Justice
Faxed to them 07-12-16

Defendant Matthew W Johnson in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the victim is in court today and would like to make a statement.  Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1).  Atty Hendee files with the court and the defense a written statement from the victim.  Atty Hendee also gives the clerk a cashier's check for $9,145.02 that he asks that the clerk pay out to the victim.
Court reviews the victim impact statement. 
Atty Sarbacker states that the agreement also includes that the State will not charge out any felony charges on this.  Atty Hendee agrees to that.
Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  
BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1, Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1).

Victim makes a statement to the court.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Sarbacker makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Court orders 5 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before August 31, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Credit = 1 day
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200 Surcharge
Restitution = $8,313.66 + $831.36 surcharge = $9,145.02
  COC office to pay out Restitution to the victim.
Bond to be applied; balance be returned to the party that posted it.
Return date on July 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew W Johnson in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he did have a pre-trial with Atty Sarbacker however, an offer wasn't given until this morning.  Atty Sarbacker did receive that settlement however it did not have restitution information.  

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on May 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew W Johnson in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Sarbacker states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.
  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for May 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Notice of Appearance
Atty Steven J. Sarbacker - SBN: 1024391
